alert.note: Alert for Angelina; Cherokee; Nacogdoches (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 28 at 10:54AM CDT until May 02 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Angelina River Near Alto affecting Nacogdoches, Angelina and Cherokee Counties. For the Angelina River...including Alto, Lufkin...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON TO EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Angelina River Near Alto. * WHEN...From Sunday afternoon to early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 29.0 feet, Expect lowland flooding of the river bottom. Ranchers that have cattle and equipment near the river should move them to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CDT Friday the stage was 19.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Sunday afternoon to a crest of 29.1 feet Sunday evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Monday morning. - Flood stage is 29.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 1100 AM CDT.
